srankingStrategy:
Match Audinos to Mega evolve it. It is
really easy to beat. This also
introduces you to Mega Evolution.
notes:
Moves: At least 5 moves left
This may be your first stage to S-Rank.
Come back here with Fighting Types to
S-Rank it
mobileNotes:
She'll give you a heart since she 
cant wait to see.... Also the end of
tutorial

pokemon:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 3 Mareeps
Timer: None
srankingStrategy:
The Disruption was not really
threatening. Just match the 3
Mareeps and its straightforward from
here
notes:
Moves: At least 8 moves left
Not really hard. Dont try to add Mareeps.
It is not very effective and will not help
you in a long run

pokemon:
Board: None
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 3 Rocks
srankingStrategy:
Still easy to beat. Just go and make
some combos
notes:
Moves: At least 5 moves left
Just make sure you dont collect Wooden 
Blocks and match more Super Effectives

pokemon:
Board: 15 Rocks
Initial: None
Timer: None
srankingStrategy: Swap A2 with D6 for an easy win
notes:
Moves: At least 2 moves left
Your first move should be a match at the
center of the board. This will clear most
rocks for you to combo and clear it at
your next turn. Also Move+5 will S-Rank
this if needed

pokemon:
Board: 2nd & 4th Column: 3 Rocks at top.
Initial: None
Timer: None
srankingStrategy: Not much I can say about it.
notes:
Moves: At least 5 moves left
Just make sure to destroy the disruption
at the boards first before going for combo

pokemon:
Board: 4th Column is Rocks as well as 2
           more blocks and 4 Nidorans.
Initial: None
Timer: None
srankingStrategy:
Switch C3 (third column, third row)
with E2 (fifth column, second row)
notes:
Moves: At least 1 moves left
If you follow the Clearing strategy, you'll
S-Rank it

pokemon:
Board: None.
Initial: Adds 3 Nidoran M
Timer: Adds 3 Nidoran F. Then will
          alternate between M and F after 
          every 4 turns
srankingStrategy:
Bring Nidoran F and Nidoran M for
easy combos.
notes:
Moves: At least 5 moves left
Bring both Nidorans here. Although at later
levels, 4 Super Effective will be better

pokemon:
Board: None.
Initial: Adds 5 Klefki
Timer: None
srankingStrategy:
Not much I can say. If you want, match
the Klefkis so you can combo well
notes:
Moves: At least 5 moves left
Still relatively easy even with the Klefkis

pokemon:
Board: None.
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 3 Rocks every 3 turns
srankingStrategy:
Combo will do this. Just watch out for
the disruptions
notes:
Moves: At least 5 moves left
Still easy for now

pokemon:
Board: None.
Initial: None
Timer: Places 4 Rocks every 3 turns

Half Health: Adds 2x2 Rocks every 3 turns
srankingStrategy:
Just same with Kangaskhan except
this one is 4 blocks.
notes:
Moves: At least 5 moves left
Still not hard to S-Rank. If you cannot do it
now, then gather some fighting type
Pokemons first
